Class Story

  • java.lang.Object
    • Story
  • public class Story
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Story chosen by the user in the Choose Your Own Adventure Driver program. It contains the Story's line count, as well as String representations of the Story's title, folder location, and local path.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Story()
      The default Story is a representation of "zombies.txt" which was used to model this project.
      Story​(java.lang.String title)
      Creates a new Story by passing the file name (or title) as a parameter in the constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      int getLineCount()  
      java.lang.String getStoryPath()  
      java.lang.String getTitle()  
      int numLines()
      Returns the total line count of your Story.
      void overWrite()
      Clears the contents of a previously completed Story's text file so that a new play through may be saved.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the title and path of the Story
      void turn​(java.lang.String[] story, int lineNum)
      Using the String[] that indexes each line of the Story this method prints the Story's current turn to the console as well as to the document that will contain the completed Story.
      int validChoice​(int userChoice)
      Writes any user inputted choices to the completed Story file.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Story

        public Story()
        The default Story is a representation of "zombies.txt" which was used to model this project.

      • Story

        public Story​(java.lang.String title)
        Creates a new Story by passing the file name (or title) as a parameter in the constructor. Also contains the path for where the completed story will be located.
        Parameters:
        title - the file name (or title) of your Story

    • Method Detail

      • getCompletedStory

        public java.lang.String getCompletedStory()

      • getStoryPath

        public java.lang.String getStoryPath()

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()

      • getLineCount

        public int getLineCount()

      • numLines

        public int numLines()
        Returns the total line count of your Story. This method is particularly useful when creating a new array place your Story in.
        Returns:
        the number of lines in your Story

      • turn

        public void turn​(java.lang.String[] story,
                 int lineNum)
        Using the String[] that indexes each line of the Story this method prints the Story's current turn to the console as well as to the document that will contain the completed Story.
        Parameters:
        story - the array filled with each line of your story
        lineNum - can either be the user choice for that turn or the line (or turn) of the Story you would like to display.

      • validChoice

        public int validChoice​(int userChoice)
        Writes any user inputted choices to the completed Story file. Checks if user input was a valid choice for the turn. If not, it will prompt the user for a different option until the user has picked a valid choice. If so, method returns the user's choice.
        Parameters:
        userChoice - the numeric choice or option inputted/selected by the user
        Returns:
        a valid choice, used to navigate to the next turn

      • overWrite

        public void overWrite()
        Clears the contents of a previously completed Story's text file so that a new play through may be saved.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the title and path of the Story
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        title and path of Story
